questions.question: In Reading Lolita in Tehran, Sanaz changes her appearance before she goes outside because

choices.answer: The mortality police are looking for her.
She is carrying a book bag.
She wants to avoid attention.
The weather is very cold.

questions.question: The author of Reading Lolita in Tehran describes the streets of Tehran as “a war zone” (line 50) because

choices.answer: Men routinely harass women.
Women are routinely arrested and beaten.
The Morality police routinely help women.
Women routinely harass men.

questions.question: The author says that the girls have “a real history and a fabricated one” (lines 64–65). She means that the regime...

choices.answer: Restricts young women's freedoms
Sees them as a threat to public safety
Does not allow young women to gather together
Women in Tehran make up their own history

questions.question: In the graphic novel, the government arrested and executed many students before 1990 because the students...

choices.answer: Tried to take over the government
Wore jewelry and large sunglasses
Organize mass demonstrations
Listened to western pop music

questions.question: In Persepolis 2, how do young women begin to struggle against the regime?

choices.answer: They begin to worry about their appearance
They openly criticize government officials
They protest in large groups with other students
They wear makeup and show their hair

questions.question: The author of Persepolis 2 suggests that the regime uses fear to keep women from...

choices.answer: Seeking to work in the same professions as men
Demanding basic rights and questioning the regime
Learning how the governments of other countries work
Uncovering corruption and illegal activity in the regime

questions.question: The central idea of the passage and the graphic novel is?

choices.answer: Women are not allowed to show their hair
Women are allowed to wear makeup
Women being treated unfairly in Tehran
Women's struggle being more discreet
